image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText:
a Representative from Illinois; born in Chicago, Cook County, Ill., on November 29, 1959; B.A., Sarah Lawrence College, Bronxville, N.Y., 1981; M.A., Northwestern University, Evanston, Ill., 1985; staff, Office of Communications, Executive Office of the President, William Jefferson Clinton, 1993-1999; bank executive; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Eighth Congress and to the two succeeding Congresses until his resignation on January 2, 2009 (January 3, 2003-January 2, 2009); chair, House Democratic Caucus (One Hundred Tenth Congress); reelected to the One Hundred Eleventh Congress, but declined his seat; White House Chief of Staff, 2009-2010; Mayor of Chicago, Ill., 2011-2019; United States Ambassador to Japan, 2021-present.

 

.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: Bendavid, Naftali. The Thumpin': How Rahm Emanuel and the Democrats Learned to Be Ruthless and Ended the Republican Revolution. New York: Doubleday, 2007.
Emanuel, Ezekiel, J. Brothers Emanuel: A Memoir of an American Family. New York: Random House, 2013.
Emanuel, Rahm, and Bruce Reed. The Plan: Big Ideas For America. New York: Public Affairs, 2006.
